Module demo1_main
Package Mechanics

Class Tree

java.lang.Object
Mechanics.SnakeObj
Mechanics.Tree
public class Tree extends SnakeObj
This class provides an obstacle for the game to provide more variety to the gameplay.

  • Constructor Summary

    Tree(int x, int y, int texture)

  • Constructor Details

    • Tree

      public Tree()
      This default constructor sets the texture of the tree to a random image in its relative directory boundary. It then sets the x and y position of the tree to hardcoded values.

    • Tree

      public Tree(int x, int y)
      This constructor is like the default one whereas the x and y positions are specified
      Parameters:
      x - Takes in an x position - Type int
      y - Takes in an y position - Type int

    • Tree

      public Tree(int x, int y, int texture)
      This constructor enforces an x and y position and the image position of the tree in its directory. 16 is the base number for the trees, texture is the tree number itself using a human-readable format, starting from 1 rather than 0 and then the -1 aligns the image location in its proper position. So picking tree 1, gives you tree 1 and not tree 0 which doesn't exist.
      Parameters:
      x - takes in an int to set the x position - Type int
      y - takes in an int to set the y position - Type int
      texture - takes in an int to set the texture - Type int
